EMERGENCY RESPONSE MANAGEMENT FOR PUBLIC HEALTH ADMIN GUIDE
Analytics for Emergency Program Management

Identify the hotspots in which illness or requests for emergency services are increasing so that you can allocate resources to where they’re needed most. Our pre-built dashboards give you actionable insights into the health of your community. Determine which demographic segment is most affected and pay special attention to intake numbers or patients from that segment. Track emergency requests from your community and ensure that you’re proactive and effective in providing emergency assistance.

Emergency Response Overview Dashboard

The Emergency Response Overview dashboard provides insights into the total picture of your community’s health. View data for existing patients, individuals who have reported themselves as being affected, contacts who’ve been exposed, and emergency requests. Filter data and drill down into each area to discover more details.

Intake Dashboard

See how the age in days of leads that are new, the increase or decrease of patients over time, and the count of exposed patients.

Patient Details Dashboard

See the number of patients that fall into categories based on metrics like condition, testing status, number of traced contacts, and how many individuals are being monitored at home.

Patient Demographics Dashboard

Monitor trends in age, gender, or location so that you can see hotspots or areas of recovery and allocate resources accordingly.

Visits Dashboard

Manage the delivery of emergency services by gaining insights into the total number of visits your agency has completed over time.

Analytics Metrics Definitions
Know more about key metrics shown in Analytics for Emergency Response for Public Health dashboards.
